ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Week in level/study
Miscellaneous comments on study, interview, methodology relevant to this form data
Mania/Hypomania: Explosive Irritability / Anger - Current
Notes: 0= No information; 1= Not present; 2= Subthreshold: Definite periods of excessively irritable/angry mood. Anger/irritability is out of proportion for the situation and occurs for much of the day or intensely for a brief period (<1 hour); 3= Threshold: Episodes of explosive irritability / anger that are far out of proportion to any stressor or stimuli - has associated aggressive behavior (e.g., threats, property destruction or phyiscal aggression). Occurs on at least 2 consecutive days or on at least 3 separate days within one week.

ElementDescription: Mania/Hypomania: Explosive Irritability / Anger - Most Severe Past
Notes: 0= No information; 1= Not present; 2= Subthreshold: Definite periods of excessively irritable/angry mood. Anger/irritability is out of proportion for the situation and occurs for much of the day or intensely for a brief period (<1 hour); 3; Threshold: Episodes of explosive irritability / anger that are far out of proportion to any stressor or stimuli - has associated aggressive behavior (e.g., threats, property destruction or phyiscal aggression). Occurs on at least 2 consecutive days or on at least 3 separate days within one week.

ElementDescription: Mania/Hypomania 1 - Current Episode
Notes: 0= 1 day (Present for at least 4 hours total in the day); 1= Distinct mood episodes last 2-3 days; 2= Distinct mood episodes last 4-6 days; 3= Distinct mood episodes last greater than or equal to 7 days

ElementDescription: Mania/Hypomania 1 - Indicate whether current mood isï¿½
Notes: 0= Irritable only; 1= Elevated / elated only; 2= Elevated/elated and irritable

ElementDescription: Mania/Hypomania 1 - Most Severe Past
Notes: 0= 1 day (Present for at least 4 hours total in the day); 1= Distinct mood episodes last 2-3 days; 2= Distinct mood episodes last 4-6 days; 3= Distinct mood episodes last greater than or equal to 7 days

ElementDescription: Mania/Hypomania 1 - Indicate whether past mood was
Notes: 0= Irritable only; 1= Elevated / elated only; 2= Elevated/elated and irritable

ElementDescription: Mania/Hypomania 10. Influence of Drugs or Alcohol - Current
Notes: 0= No Information; 1= Manic symptoms never occur under the influence of drugs; 2= Manic symptoms occur sometimes but not always under the influence of alcohol or drugs. At least once was manic or hypomanic without prior drug or alc use; 3= Manic symptoms present only under the influence of alcohol or drugs

ElementDescription: Mania/Hypomania 10. Influence of Drugs or Alcohol - Past
Notes: 0= No Information; 1= Manic symptoms never occur under the influence of drugs; 2= Manic symptoms occur sometimes but not always under the influence of alcohol or drugs. At least once was manic or hypomanic without prior drug or alc use; 3= Manic symptoms present only under the influence of alcohol or drugs

ElementDescription: Mania/Hypomania 11a. Patterning of Manic Symptoms - Longest duration of (Hypo)Manic Periods
Notes: 0= No Information; 1= One day (>4 hours durng the day; 2= 2-3 days; 3= 4-6 days; 4= 7-14 days; 5= Multiple weeks; 6= 2-6 months; 7= > 6 months

ElementDescription: Mania/Hypomania 11b. Longest duration of (Hypo)Manic Periods
Notes: 0= No Information; 1= One day (>4 hours durng the day; 2= 2-3 days; 3= 4-6 days; 4= 7-14 days; 5= Multiple weeks; 6= 2-6 months; 7= > 6 months

ElementDescription: Mania/Hypomania 11c. Number of Episodes per Year
Notes: 0= No Information; 1= One day (>4 hours durng the day; 2= 2-3 days; 3= 4-6 days; 4= 7-14 days; 5= Multiple weeks; 6= 2-6 months; 7= > 6 months

ElementDescription: Number of Episodes Per Year
Number of Episodes Per Month
Mania/Hypomania 11d. Longest Duration of Euthymic Mood
Notes: 0= No Information; 1= No significant periods of euthymic mood; 2= Euthymic mood lasts 3-6 day; 3= Euthymic mood has lasted 1-2 weeks; 4= Euthymic mood has lasted 2-8 weeks; 5= Eutymic mood has lasted > 2 months

ElementDescription: Mania/Hypomania 11e. Total Lifetyme Duration of Mania/Hypomania
Notes: 0= No Information; 1= 1-3 days; 2= 4-10 days; 3= 10-20 days; 4= More than 20 days

Mania/Hypomania 13. Evidence of Manic Episode
Mania/Hypomania 13. Evidence of Manic Episode
Mania/Hypomania: Distinct period of abnormally and persistently elevated, expansive, or irritable mood lasting at least one week (or any duration if hospitalized) AND - Score of 3
Mania/Hypomania: Abnormally increased activity lasting at least one week (or any duration if hospitalized) - Score of 3
Mania/Hypomania: Symptom 1) Inflated self-esteem or grandiosity - Score of 3
Mania/Hypomania: Symptom 2) Decreased need for sleep (e.g., feel rested after only 3 hours of sleep) - Score of 3
Mania/Hypomania: Symptom 3) More talkative than usual or pressure to keep talking - Score of 3
Mania/Hypomania: Symptom 4) Flight of ideas or subjective experience that thoughts are racing - Score of 3
Mania/Hypomania: Symptom 5)  Distractiblity (i.e., attention too easily drawn to unimportant or irrelevant external stimuli) - Score of 3
Mania/Hypomania: Symptom 6)  Increase in goal directed activity or psychomotor agitation - Score of 3
Mania/Hypomania: Symptom 7) Excessive involvement in pleasurable activities that have a high potential for painful consequences - Score of 3
